description: UK opinion polls have been remarkably consistent over the six-week general election campaign: The opposition Labour Party is projected to win, and leader Keir Starmer will be Britain’s new prime minister.
title: Five Ways Labour Can Get Back to Power in the UK

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government has published options it will consider for deterring Chinese-made electric vehicles from accessing the Canadian market, including putting tariffs on imported and blocking Chinese investment in new Canadian factories.
title: Canada to Consider Blocking Factories in Pushback on Chinese EVs

description: A record number of people are running in the capital’s gubernatorial election, but many are just using it as a chance to promote their own profiles.
title: Joke Candidates Are Flooding Tokyo’s Governor Race

description: Russia’s reliance on China has gotten to the point where Beijing could end the war in Ukraine if it chose to, Finnish President Alexander Stubb said.
title: China Can End Russia’s War in Ukraine With One Phone Call, Finland Says

description: Donald Trump’s conviction on 34 felony counts for falsifying business records to cover up a sex scandal is now up in the air because of the Supreme Court’s landmark ruling July 1 on presidential immunity.
title: Why Trump’s Hush Money Conviction Is in Legal Limbo

description: Boris Johnson made an unexpected campaign appearance on Tuesday night to urge Conservative voters to deny Labour a landslide victory at the UK general election, a last throw of the dice by Rishi Sunak’s Tories to try to prevent huge losses that are expected at Thursday’s vote.
title: Boris Johnson Makes Surprise Late Move to Avert Tory Wipeout

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, national health-care reporter Riley Griffin explains why an op-ed by President Joe Biden and Senator Bernie Sanders sent Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly shares tumbling. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Obesity Drug Prices Give Biden a Chance to Go Back on Offensive

description: Chinese and Russian companies are developing an attack drone similar to an Iranian model deployed in Ukraine, European officials familiar with the matter said, a sign that Beijing may be edging closer to providing the sort of lethal aid that western officials have warned against.
title: China Is Building and Testing Lethal Attack Drones for Russia

description: President Joe Biden’s favorability numbers plummeted after his debate performance last week in “the largest single-week drop” in nearly three years, according to a leaked memo from a pollster that was published Tuesday by the news site Puck.
title: Biden Plummets in Leaked Democratic Polling Memo, Puck Says

description: A Russian warship arrived on Venezuela’s coast hours after Nicolás Maduro announced renewed talks between his government and the US ahead of a presidential election this month.
title: Venezuela Welcomes Russian Warship as Maduro Seeks New US Talks

description: Donald Trump raised $331 million in the second quarter, a fundraising haul that leaves him with more cash on hand than President Joe Biden, a development likely to intensify Democratic anxiety about the incumbent’s campaign.
title: Trump Raises $331 Million in Quarter as War Chest Now Tops Biden

description: The Biden administration told doctors and other health care providers on Tuesday that they are legally obligated to perform abortions for pregnant women experiencing medical emergencies.
title: Biden Officials Tell Doctors Emergency Abortions Are Legal Duty

description: Donald Trump’s sentencing was delayed two months until Sept. 18 so that the judge can review the impact of the US Supreme Court’s ruling about presidential immunity on the New York hush-money conviction.
title: Trump New York Sentencing Put Off to Sept. 18 to Review Immunity

description: The former chairman of Peru’s largest bank will testify in a money laundering trial against one of the country’s most powerful politicians, a prosecutor said on Tuesday.
title: Top Peruvian Banker to Take Stand Over Cash Donations to Political Scion

description: On this episode of Voternomics, Abrdn Chairman Douglas Flint explains why the new government needs to build up transportation and education.
title: UK Should Invest in Hard and Soft Infrastructure, Fund Manager Says

description: Marine Le Pen’s National Rally is facing a bigger barrier to forming France’s next government after rivals maneuvered to reduce the number of three-way races that would favor her far-right party in the final round of the legislative elections.
title: Le Pen’s Path to Power Narrows in French Game of Election Chess

description: Argentine President Javier Milei called Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva “an idiot dinosaur” and a communist, escalating a long-running feud with his neighbor a day after choosing to snub him on an upcoming visit to Brazil.
title: Milei Calls Lula an ‘Idiot Dinosaur’ Ahead of Brazil Visit

description: Rudolph Giuliani has been stripped of his law license in New York for aiding Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election results, the latest blow to the once celebrated federal prosecutor and New York mayor.
title: Rudy Giuliani Loses His New York Law License for Trump 2020 Work

description: Officials from Marine Le Pen’s movement are in advanced talks with other far-right groups in the European Parliament that could see her party abandon its current political family to join forces with Hungary’s Viktor Orban.
title: Le Pen May Ditch Her EU Parliament Group in Far-Right Shakeup

description: China’s Coast Guard detained a Taiwanese fishing boat along with its six crew members near an offshore outpost as tensions simmer under the island’s new president.
title: China Seizes Taiwan Fishing Boat and Crew as Tensions Simmer

description: President Joe Biden plans to speak with Democratic governors, as he works furiously to quell calls to end his reelection bid and let another Democrat take on Donald Trump.
title: Biden to Meet Democratic Governors as He Looks to Close Ranks

description: The manifestos of the Conservatives, Labour, the Liberal Democrats and Reform UK represent the policies of parties that together are expected to receive about 90% of the votes in the general election on Thursday, and they agree on a lot. All say taxes on working people will not increase or will be cut, pledge to end the crisis in the National Health Service and commit to turbocharging an economy that has lagged behind its major peers in recent years.
title: UK Election Policy Guide: What the Parties Have Pledged on Tax and Business

description: The US Supreme Court hasn’t always jumped to help former President Donald Trump in his legal travails. But in perhaps the biggest case of Trump’s life, the court he shaped did enough.
title: Supreme Court Once Wary of Trump Gives Him Election-Year Boosts

description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels conducted the largest number of attacks on commercial ships so far in 2024 in June, fresh proof that the group’s threat to trade intensified in recent weeks.
title: Houthis Mount Biggest Month of Attacks on Ships This Year

description: South African lawmakers, in their first vote since a new government was formed, agreed to revive a bill allowing the National Treasury to release funds to ministries for the year through March 2025 to perform their duties.
title: South Africa Lawmakers Revive Spending Bill Under New Government

description: The court’s overturning of the Chevron doctrine will help Trump roll back environmental regulations if he wins in November.
title: Supreme Court Gives Trump ‘Sword’ to Slash Biden’s Climate Rules

description: Donald Trump’s July 11 sentencing in his New York hush-money case is almost certain to be delayed after prosecutors said they would not oppose putting it on hold in light of the US Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity in criminal cases.
title: Trump’s July 11 Sentencing Date Almost Certain to Be Delayed

description: Britain’s winner-takes-all election system favors the biggest parties — Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives and Keir Starmer’s Labour — at the expense of the minor ones. Nigel Farage’s Reform UK, for example, is projected to win 16% of the vote in a Bloomberg composite opinion poll, yet most pollsters expect the insurgent party to pick up no more than a handful of the 650 seats in the House of Commons.
title: Why Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Could Get Millions of Votes But Few MPs

description: Christine Lagarde repeated that the European Central Bank is “attentive” to the bond market, while declining to comment on the election fight dominating her home country of France.
title: Lagarde Repeats ECB Is ‘Attentive’ on Yields Amid French Vote

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s coalition will deliver a draft budget as early as Friday that aims to put an end to political infighting by boosting spending on infrastructure and defense while adhering to debt restrictions, people familiar with the matter said.
title: German Coalition Nears Budget Deal as Debt Brake Limits Options

description: The US Supreme Court opted not to add any new gun-rights cases to its agenda for the fall, sidestepping a bevy of appeals over the Constitution’s Second Amendment as the justices wound down their nine-month term.
title: Supreme Court Sidesteps New Gun Cases as It Closes Out Term

description: Egypt is set to name Ahmed Kouchouk as the country’s first new finance minister since 2018, Extranews reported, as the North African nation emerges from its worst economic crisis in decades.
title: Egypt Said to Name Kouchouk as Finance Head in Government Revamp

description: The US Supreme Court said it will hear a Biden administration appeal that aims to reinforce the Food and Drug Administration’s power to bar flavored vaping products it concludes are likely to appeal to children.
title: FDA Efforts to Curb Flavored Vapes Draw Supreme Court Review

description: Slain presidential contender Fernando Villavicencio’s running mate is now asking voters to entrust her with pulling Ecuador out of a violent crisis that’s captured global attention ever since his murder last year.
title: Murdered Candidate’s Running Mate Takes on Noboa in Ecuador Vote

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: A Dismal Inheritance Awaits Labour’s Return in the UK

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva escalated his attacks on Brazil’s central bank, saying the institution led by Governor Roberto Campos Neto needs to be really autonomous and not “owned” by financial markets.
title: Lula Says Central Bank Can’t Be at the Service of Markets

description: Marine Le Pen is seeking support from beyond her far-right National Rally party that would allow her to govern even if she falls short of an absolute majority in Sunday’s legislative election.
title: Le Pen Seeks Broad Support to Win French Parliamentary Majority

description: Maintenance work ends at key Russian oil export terminals
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Shipments Rebound to Highest Since May

description: Labour slipped to its worst rating of the UK’s general election campaign, with its lead over Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives also hitting a low for the period in Bloomberg’s poll of polls — but leader Keir Starmer nevertheless remains on course to win the keys to 10 Downing Street in Thursday’s vote.
title: Labour Slips But Stays Way Ahead of Conservatives, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak ramped up efforts to stoke fears about a huge Labour majority in a frantic last-gasp attempt to boost turnout among Conservative-minded voters before Thursday’s UK election.
title: Sunak Ramps Up the Fear Factor in Frantic Final UK Election Push

description: After President Joe Biden’s catastrophic debate performance, Gavin Newsom has emerged among a handful of names being floated to replace him. In China, that would be a popular outcome.
title: Gavin Newsom Hailed Within China After Biden’s Debate Troubles

description: Economists and some Federal Reserve officials are increasingly on alert that pain could be on the horizon for American workers amid signs the labor market is losing steam.
title: US Labor Market Shows Signs of Losing Steam, Putting the Fed on Alert

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: French Mainstream Confronts Far-Right Momentum

description: President Joe Biden’s campaign said it raised $127 million in June, offering a lifeline to the Democratic incumbent as he faces pressure to step aside following a harrowing debate performance last week.
title: Biden Touts $127 Million June Haul to Counter Post-Debate Angst

description: The Supreme Court’s decision declaring Donald Trump partially immune from prosecution for efforts to overturn the 2020 election avoided mentioning what makes it a blockbuster: He’s campaigning to reclaim the presidency.
title: Supreme Court’s Trump Immunity Ruling Avoids the Obvious: He’s Running Again

description: A hung parliament in France is more likely to produce a broad coalition government rather than an Italian-style technocrat-led administration, according to former central bank chief Jean-Claude Trichet.
title: Former ECB Head Says Government of Technocrats Won't Work in France

description: The Netherlands’ new cabinet was sworn in Tuesday, making it the first time that Geert Wilders’ far-right party became a part of the Dutch government.
title: New Dutch Cabinet Forms With Populist Wilders as Kingmaker

description: Russia has been using Kaliningrad, its exclave that borders Poland and Lithuania, as one of its bases to disrupt European Union satellite systems, according to a United Nations agency that oversees communications technology.
title: Russia Used Exclave of Kaliningrad to Disrupt EU Satellites

description: The Israeli army ordered Palestinians to leave Khan Younis ahead of a possible new assault, underscoring the struggle to stop militants regrouping in areas that were previously cleared.
title: Israel Tells Palestinians to Leave Khan Younis as Hamas Regroups

description: South African central bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago welcomed the reappointment of Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in the new coalition cabinet unveiled by the president this week.
title: South Africa’s Kganyago Welcomes Finance Minister Reappointment

description: Worried by deepening China-Russia relations, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is heading to Moscow next week for talks with President Vladimir Putin, his first visit to the country since the Kremlin’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
title: Modi Is Shoring Up Russia Ties as Putin Deepens China Embrace

description: Anti-government protests in Kenya over the past two weeks left 39 people dead and hundreds more injured, the Kenya National Commission on Human Rights said.
title: Death Toll in Kenyan Anti-Government Protests at 39, Group Says

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban arrived in Kyiv on an unannounced visit that may ease tensions with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy over Budapest’s ties with Russia and efforts to stall aid to the war-battered country.
title: Orban Makes First War-Time Kyiv Visit Amid Fraught Ukraine Ties

description: China called on the Philippines to catch and severely punish the murderers of a Chinese citizen in a kidnapping case that prompted Beijing’s diplomatic intervention.
title: China Urges Philippines to Punish Killers of Chinese Citizen

description: Hong Kong leader John Lee urged residents to take advantage of new measures announced by Beijing to facilitate cross-border exchanges as he vowed to further integrate the self-administered city into the country’s development plans.
title: Hong Kong Chief Draws City Closer to China to Boost Economy

description: Tuition caps and rising inflation have forced schools to slash costs and recruit more lucrative international students. That strategy is now colliding with limits on immigration.
title: Britain’s Famed Universities Near a Financial Cliff

description: Choice to boycott the regime’s democratic charade will have consequences.
title: Want to Know What You’re Voting For? Ask an Iranian

description: Reed Recruitment data suggest alternative pathways into the workforce have lost traction as jobs dry up.
title: University Is More Important Than Ever in Britain's Jobs Market

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is upgrading Germany’s relationship with Poland after Prime Minister Donald Tusk returned the nation to the European mainstream last year and France’s lurch to the right throws ties off balance.
title: Germany Bets on Closer Poland Ties With France’s Path Uncertain

description: Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro said his government will resume talks this month with the Biden administration ahead of the July 28 presidential elections.
title: Venezuela, US to Resume Talks Ahead of Presidential Vote

description: Leader Kim Jong Un said North Korea’s economy is on a “clear upturn” as his state claimed a successful test of a new tactical ballistic missile that could be sent to Russia in exchange for aid to help his regime.
title: Kim Jong Un Says Economy Is on ‘Upturn’ as Russian Ties Deepen

description: Donald Trump is making a new push to get his New York hush-money conviction tossed out after the US Supreme Court ruled that he has substantial immunity from criminal prosecution for actions he took while president.
title: Trump Seeks to Toss NY Felony Conviction After Immunity Win
